basic.description:
This course will examine how characteristics and configurations of urban environments, such as urban sprawl, transportation, community design, housing, and food networks, may promote or impede health and well-being. This seminar-style course will be especially useful for students considering careers in public health and/or urban planning.
LEARNING HOURS    120 (18S;10Oc;72P)
basic.subject: HLTH
basic.title: Health and Built Environments

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Prerequisites     Level 4 in a KINE or PHED Specialization or HLTH Major or Medial Plan.
Exclusion    No more than 3.0 units from HLTH497 (if taken between 2012-2015); HLTH455
